content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> has the property that as <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gets closer and closer to 3, the values of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> get closer and closer to 5. Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 5, of, f of x, equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 1.2: Defining Limits and Using Limit Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
